business.headline: Who are the 6 Indian firms sanctioned by the US and what's at stake?Six Indian firms have been sanctioned by the US for allegedly importing Iranian petrochemicals. Here's all you need to know about them.

ITR-U now open: Update your past ITR mistakes for AY 2021-22 and 2022-23The Income Tax Department has now made it possible to file updated returns (ITR-U) for Assessment Years (AY) 2021-22 and 2022-23 using the ITR-1 and ITR-2 forms. This move aims to help people fix any errors or income details they may have missed earlier.

Trump's 25% tariffs: Which sectors should brace for impact?US President Donald Trump announced a 25% tariff on Indian exports starting August 1.  An additional penalty was also announced for India's continued oil purchases from Russia, which has added more uncertainty for businesses.

Explained: Why Trump's 25% tariff is a double whammy for IndiaThe move comes at a time when Indian exports are already under pressure and global demand remains uneven. It also marks a sharp deterioration in bilateral negotiations that had, until recently, appeared to be progressing toward a limited trade understanding.

Sensex falls 500 points: Why is stock market down todayHeavyweight stocks fell in early trade. The S&P BSE Sensex fell over 575 points in early trade to 80,907.34, while the NSE Nifty50 dropped 185 points to 24,670.15 by 10 am.
US calls India the 'tariff king'. But its own duties go as high as 350%Donald Trump has called India tariff king, but the U.S. quietly charges 350% on milk, tobacco, and fruit.
Sensex opens 590 points lower, Nifty below 24,700; RIL shares fall 2%The S&P BSE Sensex lost 536.92 points to 80,944.94, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 156.35 points to 24,698.70 as of 9:26 am.

Trump announces 25% tariff: Why India and US still don't have a trade dealDespite several rounds of talks, the two nations have not managed to bridge key differences. Speaking at a press conference at the White House, Trump said that India remains one of the highest tariff-imposing countries in the world, but discussions are underway.

US imposes 25% tariff on India. Will Sensex, Nifty crash today?The GIFT Nifty futures, which reflect early cues for the market, were trading 179 points lower at 24,675, down 0.73%, signalling a weak start for Dalal Street.

US imposes 25% tariff on India: What it means for exports and key sectorsThe newly announced duties target several of India's top-performing export sectors, like auto components, steel, aluminum, smartphones, gems and jewellery. Pharmaceuticals, semiconductors, and critical minerals, however, have been excluded.

How the subscription lifestyle is fuelling a new wave of debtFrom entertainment and food to wellness and shopping, subscription models are everywhere. While they promise convenience, they're also leading many into silent debt traps, especially the younger, digital-savvy crowd.
Sensex closes 144 points higher, Nifty above 24,800; L&T up 4%The S&P BSE Sensex gained 143.91 points to close at 81,481.86, while the NSE Nifty50 added 33.95 points to end at 24,855.05.

entertainment.headline: Courtney Cox calls Friends co-star Lisa Kudrow her loot in touching birthday postActor Courtney Cox shared the most touching birthday post for her "loot" Lisa Kudrow. The latter turned 62 on July 30.

Love, Money, Madness and Fame: The Enduring Philosophy of Kishore KumarOn August 4, 2025, we celebrate what would have been the 96th birthday of Kishore Kumar—the legendary singer, actor, and filmmaker whose unparalleled talent and eccentric charm left an indelible imprint on Indian cinema. In this series, we explore the multifaceted life of this enigmatic genius, delving into his complex relationships with love, marriage, money, madness, and fame. The first part of this special series traces Kishore's quest for love—a journey marked by passion, heartbreak, and resilience—tragically cut short by his sudden death in 1987.

Katrina Kaif and Vicky Kaushal ferry-off to Alibaug together, video goes viralKatrina Kaif and Vicky Kaushal were recently seen heading to Alibaug. Katrina's outfit and their low-key appearance sparked fresh pregnancy rumours.

5 Bollywood romantic films Gen-Z will relate to if they liked Saiyaara so muchWhile the popularity of Mohit Suri's 'Saiyaara' refuses to slow down, Gen-Z is beginning to look back at a time when love unfolded through soulful songs and heartfelt monologues in Bollywood. As the 2000s romantic classics find new life through re-releases and streaming platforms, today's generation is rediscovering what it truly means to fall-and grow-in love.

Vijay Deverakonda's Kingdom team meets Pawan Kalyan on Ustaad Bhagat Singh setVijay Deverakonda and the team of his upcoming movie 'Kingdom' met Pawan Kalyan on the sets of 'Ustaad Bhagat Singh'. 'Kingdom' hit theatres today.

Saiyaara box office Day 13: Rs 300 crore a cakewalk for Ahaan Panday's film nowYRF's 'Saiyaara' is moving towards the Rs 300 crore club. The Mohit Suri-directorial is in its third weekend, and it will now face 'Son of Sardaar 2' and 'Dhadak 2' at the box office.

Coldplay to Travis Scott: Indian concerts may create 12 million jobs; are we ready?India's live concert economy is rapidly expanding, projected to create 12 million jobs by 2032. This growth highlights opportunities in tier 2 and 3 cities but also underscores skill shortages needing urgent attention.

Karisma in Delhi with children amid Sanjay Kapur's Rs 30,000 crore estate battleActor Karisma Kapoor arrived in Delhi with her children, Kiaan and Samaira, amid her late ex-husband Sunjay Kapur's property feud.

Kerala Rapper Vedan faces sexual assault case over false promise of marriageA sexual harassment case has been registered against Kerala rapper Vedan involving allegations of a false promise of marriage. He was previously arrested in a drug-related case.

Head Over Heels review: Choo Young Woo, Cho Yi-hyun shine in wholesome K-drama'Head Over Heels' is a fresh K-drama blending young love with Korean mythology. The series delivers a heartfelt story with strong performances, available on Prime Video India.

Vijay Sethupathi slams filthy sexual harassment claims, takes legal actionActor Vijay Sethupathi has finally spoken out regarding serious casting couch allegations made against him by a woman on social media.
In Nick- Priyanka's July, beach, broadway, and Malti stealing spotlightOn July 31, Nick Jonas shared heartfelt moments from July with Priyanka Chopra and Malti on social media.

Raj Nidimoru miffed at paps after casual dinner date with Samantha in Mumbai. PicsActor Samantha Ruth Prabhu and director Raj Nidimoru stepped out on a dinner date in Mumbai amid relationship rumours. Neither has confirmed their relationship status despite public interest.

Kingdom X review: Vijay Deverakonda delivers career-best act in emotional filmVijay Deverakonda's 'Kingdom' released on July 31 amid massive anticipation. Internet users on X, who caught the early shows, called it one of his best performances in his career.

Zootopia 2 trailer: Nick, Judy attend couple counselling amid giant snake chaseZootopia 2 trailer: Rookie cops Nick and Judy seek couple counselling while solving a mysterious case of a giant snake on the leash. The upcoming animation film is scheduled for a theatrical release on November 28.

Jamie Lee Curtis says plastic surgery has led to genocide of women, slams AI filtersActor Jamie Lee Curtis called plastic surgery a 'genocide' of natural beauty. She also warned against AI filters as they worsen unrealistic beauty standards for women.

Sharon Orbourne moved to tears at Ozzy Osbourne's funeral procession in BirminghamOzzy Osbourne was laid to rest in his hometown of Birmingham today. The funeral saw thousands of fans and family paying emotional tribute to the Black Sabbath frontman.

Ramayana actor Indira Krishnan on casting couch: Lost big projects for saying noActor Indira Krishnan opened up about facing casting couch experiences, especially in the South film industry, revealing she lost major roles for refusing inappropriate demands. She said these incidents led her to shift focus to television, where she found more respect and better opportunities.

Pushpa actor Anasuya Bharadwaj shuts down trolls questioning her fashion choicesAnasuya Bharadwaj addressed social media criticism about her fashion choices as a mother, promoting acceptance and respect for individuality. She shared a lengthy note on social media, discussing choices and values.

general news.headline: No evidence: All Malegaon blast accused, including Pragya Thakur, acquittedMalegaon blasts verdict: The blasts in Malegaon killed six people and injured over 100. Seventeen years later, all the seven accused have been acquitted.

Court can't convict just on moral ground: 10 top quotes from Malegaon verdictWhile delivering the verdict, Special Judge AK Lahoti said the prosecution relied "merely on suspicion" and failed to prove the charges beyond reasonable doubt.
US calls India the 'tariff king'. But its own duties go as high as 350%Donald Trump has called India tariff king, but the U.S. quietly charges 350% on milk, tobacco, and fruit.

ENG vs IND 5th Test: Can riled-up India land final punch to square series?Having secured a draw in Manchester, India have a great chance to level the series at the Oval against a depleted England side. Shubman Gill and his men have batted and bowled out of their skins time and again in the series so far, and now have a chance to punch above their weight in the finale.

Why India returned Haji Pir Pass to Pakistan after capturing it in 1965India captured the Haji Pir Pass in 1965 in a big military achievement, but returned it to Pakistan just months later under the Tashkent Agreement. Critics argue that the move compromised long-term security in Kashmir. But why did India give control of Haji Pir Pass to Pakistan despite wresting the strategic site from it?

Can take their dead economies down together: Trump hits out at India, RussiaIn a fiery post on Truth Social, Trump doubled down on his long-standing gripe over India's trade practices, accusing the country of levying "among the highest tariffs in the world" and blaming New Delhi for what he claimed was "very little business" between the two nations.

Became sanyasi 2 years before blast: What court said on Pragya ThakurA special court acquitted Sadhvi Pragya and Lt Colonel Prasad Purohit - the face of the Malegaon case - 17 years after a blast rocked the communally sensitive town.

Jat conundrum: Jagdeep Dhankar's exit bares BJP's struggle with communityEngineering a Jat breakthrough for long, the BJP has instead built a fragile edifice of borrowed faces and paper alliances, just one defection or protest away from collapse

From dual incomes to debt: The silent struggle of parents paying private school feesMiddle-class Indian families struggle with sharply rising private school fees and related lifestyle changes. Despite existing fee regulations, poor enforcement leaves parents bearing heavy financial and emotional costs.

God will punish those who insulted 'bhagwa': Pragya Thakur after acquittalFormer BJP MP Pragya Thakur was acquitted in the 2008 Malegaon blast case after 17 years, with the court citing lack of reliable evidence. Reacting to the verdict, Pragya Thakur called it a victory for 'saffron' and justice.

Trump's 25% tariff on India, and what it means nextIn a shock move that rattled both diplomacy and markets, the US announced a sweeping 25% tariff on all Indian exports starting August 1, 2025. How did this happen? What's behind such a drastic step? And where do things go from here? We answer all your questions.

Maybe they'll sell to India: Trump strikes trade deal, oil partnership with PakDonald Trump announced a new US-Pakistan oil trade deal, hinting it could pave the way for future exports to India. The move follows Trump's declaration of a 25% tariff and extra penalties on goods imported from India.

The Trumpian paradox: For India, its riskier being his friend than rivalTrump threw a curveball at India by announcing a 25% tariff on merchandise exports plus an undisclosed penalty. On the other hand, Trump keeps extending the deadline for China, a noted adversary.

Who are the 6 Indian firms sanctioned by the US and what's at stake?Six Indian firms have been sanctioned by the US for allegedly importing Iranian petrochemicals. Here's all you need to know about them.

Beyond raves and speakeasies, Delhi's past is redefining nightlifeDelhi after dark is not just coffee raves or pubs. Its historic allure is slowly reviving night tourism with lit-up tombs, museums and light and sound shows.

Isro will unfold Nisar's origami antenna in space: Explained in graphicsAll eyes are on the commissioning phase of the mission, which will begin with the unfolding of the antenna that had been folded for launch.

Video shows potholes near highways office, internet sees through the cracksAs the video of the poor road conditions outside the country's top highways authority went viral, the NHAI reacted swiftly and blamed the Delhi PWD for it.

Khushbu Sundar becomes BJP Tamil Nadu Vice-President, urges actor Vijay to allyActor-politician Khushbu Sundar has been appointed BJP Vice-President in Tamil Nadu. She aims to boost grassroots outreach and has urged actor Vijay's party to join the BJP-AIADMK alliance.

ChatGPT study mode now live in India for free, supports 11 languages: How to useChatGPT's new Study Mode is now live in India, offering free, multilingual, interactive learning for students in 11 languages. The AI tool helps learners understand concepts step by step across subjects and skill levels.

sports.headline: 4th Test, London Weather Live Updates: Will rain delay start of play on Day 1?India (IND) vs England (ENG), 4th Test, London Weather Day 1 Live Updates: India and England are set to face off in the final Test of the Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy, with the hosts holding a 2-1 lead and the visitors eager to level the series. According to AccuWeather, Thursday's play could be affected by overcast conditions in the morning and the likelihood of showers in the afternoon, with thunderstorms forecast between 3 and 5 PM.

Titans vs Thalaivas in opener, Vizag, Jaipur, Chennai, Delhi return as venuesThe Pro Kabaddi League season 12 is all set to kickstart from August 29 in Vizag with the Telugu Titans taking on Tamil Thalaivas in the opening match. The PKL will take place across four cities this season.

Brad Haddin slams England for Manchester Day 5 drama: I liked what India didFormer Australia wicketkeeper Brad Haddin has taken a swipe at England for their conduct during the closing stages of the fourth Test in Manchester, accusing Ben Stokes' side of attempting to call off the match prematurely once a win was no longer possible.

Wicketkeeping first: Dhruv Jurel reacts to MS Dhoni meme ahead of Oval TestDhruv Jurel opened up on the memes he got after just being asked to do the wicketkeeper's job in the ongoing series against England. Jurel played the last two games as a substitute wicketkeeper and didn't get a chance to bat.

Aakash Chopra slams England's spin bowling choices for Oval TestAakash Chopra has questioned England's decision to enter the final Test of the Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy without a specialist spinner, calling it a surprising move ahead of a high-stakes decider.

Ruben Amorim remains coy on Manchester United transfer plans, Sesko linksManchester United manager Ruben Amorim remained coy about potential transfer activity and links to Benjamin Sesko following his side's dominant 4-1 win over Bournemouth in the Premier League Summer Series.

Divya Deshmukh gets grand reception after World Cup win, credits family for triumphDivya Deshmukh was overwhelmed as she received a grand welcome from her hometown of Nagpur on Wednesday, July 31 after her Women's World Cup win in Georgia.

Stokes, Gill question short 3-day gap between Tests in 5-match seriesBen Stokes and Shubman Gill on Wednesday called for longer gaps between matches, stating that a three-day break is too short for a five-Test series like the ongoing one, especially given the heavy workload on the bowlers.

Oval Test: Gambhir's chance to show India's ready for post-Rohit-Kohli eraThe Oval Test presents Gautam Gambhir with a golden opportunity to prove he's the right man to lead India's next-gen Test team in the post-Rohit-Kohli era. With the series on the line, this could well be his defining red-ball moment.

Football fever returns to Imphal as TRAU FC, NEROCA clash in Durand Cup openerNEROCA FC snatched a dramatic 1-1 draw against 10-man TRAU FC in their Group E opener at the 134th IndianOil Durand Cup in Imphal on Wednesday.

Mhatre to lead, Suryavanshi retained as India announce U19 squad for AUS tourAyush Mhatre will captain the India U19 side on their Australia tour starting September. The squad retains core players from the England tour, aiming to build on recent successes.

Divya Deshmukh gets grand reception after World Cup win, credits family for triumphDivya Deshmukh was overwhelmed as she received a grand welcome from her hometown of Nagpur on Wednesday, July 31 after her Women's World Cup win in Georgia.

Mhatre to lead, Suryavanshi retained as India announce U19 squad for AUS tourAyush Mhatre will captain the India U19 side on their Australia tour starting September. The squad retains core players from the England tour, aiming to build on recent successes.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
